question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Suppose $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv n\pmod{20}$, where $0\le n<20$.

What is the value of $n$?

$77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \pmod{20} = (77 \pmod{20}) \cdot (88 \pmod{20}) \cdot (99 \pmod{20})$
$77 \equiv 77 - 3 \cdot 20 = 77-60 = 17 \pmod{20}$
$88 \equiv 88 - 4 \cdot 20 = 88-80 = 8 \pmod{20}$
$99 \equiv 99 - 4 \cdot 20 = 99-80 = 19 \pmod{20}$
So we have $17 \cdot 8 \cdot 19 \pmod{20} = (17 \cdot 8) \cdot 19 \pmod{20}$
$17 \cdot 8 = 136 \equiv 136 - 6 \cdot 20 = 136 - 120 = 16 \pmod{20}$
$16 \cdot 19 = 304 \equiv 304 - 15 \cdot 20 = 304 - 300 = 4 \pmod{20}$
Final Answer: $\boxed{4}$

There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
